# Project Structure Documentation

## Standard Directory Layout
```
project_root/
├── docs/
│   ├── development/
│   │   ├── diary.rmd
│   │   ├── postgres_diary.rmd
│   │   └── development_diary.json
│   ├── research/
│   │   ├── papers/
│   │   ├── references/
│   │   └── experiments/
│   ├── specs/
│   │   ├── architecture/
│   │   ├── api/
│   │   └── database/
│   └── templates/
├── src/
│   ├── core/
│   ├── api/
│   ├── database/
│   └── utils/
├── tests/
│   ├── unit/
│   ├── integration/
│   └── performance/
├── scripts/
│   ├── setup/
│   ├── deployment/
│   └── maintenance/
├── config/
│   ├── development/
│   ├── staging/
│   └── production/
└── research/
    ├── reference_repos/
    ├── experiments/
    └── analysis/
```

## Directory Purposes

### `/docs`
- Development documentation
- Research papers and references
- Technical specifications
- Template files

### `/src`
- Core application code
- API implementations
- Database models and migrations
- Utility functions

### `/tests`
- Unit tests
- Integration tests
- Performance tests
- Test fixtures

### `/scripts`
- Setup scripts
- Deployment automation
- Maintenance utilities

### `/config`
- Environment-specific configurations
- Application settings
- Service configurations

### `/research`
- Reference implementations
- Experimental code
- Analysis notebooks

## File Naming Conventions
- Use lowercase with underscores
- Include version numbers where applicable
- Use appropriate file extensions
- Follow language-specific conventions

## Documentation Requirements
Each project must maintain:
1. Development diary (`diary.rmd`)
2. Database documentation (`postgres_diary.rmd`)
3. Project metadata (`development_diary.json`)
4. API specifications
5. Architecture diagrams
